intro: Senecio caroli-tertii, commonly known as the Caroli-Tertii groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in the spring, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets.
